lead_paragraph: The rate of gastroschisis has increased about 30 percent since 1995, the agency reported. For young black mothers, the increase was 263 percent.
snippet: The rate of gastroschisis has increased about 30 percent since 1995, the agency reported. For young black mothers, the increase was 263 percent.

headline.main: Rate of Birth Defect of Abdominal Wall Increasing, C.D.C. Says
headline.print_headline: Rise in Birth Defect of Abdominal Wall Alarms C.D.C.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researchers report alarming increase in frequency of serious birth defect known as gastroschisis; prevalence of defect has risen around 30 percent, to 4.9 births out of 10,000 from 2006 to 2012, from 3.6 per 10,000 between 1995 and 2005; researchers do not why increase is occurring, and note that it is higher among non-Hispanic black teens.
